sea_ice_plotter moduleÔÉÅ

class sea_ice_plotter.SeaIcePlotter(sim_name, dt0_str, dtN_str=None, json_path=None, hemisphere=None, overwrite=False, show_figs=False, prepare=True, single_figure=False, ice_type='FI')[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Class to plot fast ice and pack ice fields from AFIM simulations.

This class supports reading spatial and temporal Zarr datasets for fast or pack ice and generates static maps or time series visualisations using PyGMT.

Parameters:

  • sim_name (str) ‚Äì Name of the simulation (used to locate output directories).

  • dt0_str (str) ‚Äì Start date string (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

  • dtN_str (str, optional) ‚Äì End date string. Required for multi-date plots.

  • json_path (str or Path, optional) ‚Äì Path to the AFIM project JSON configuration.

  • hemisphere (str, optional) ‚Äì Hemisphere to focus on (‚Äònorth‚Äô or ‚Äòsouth‚Äô). Defaults to config setting.

  • overwrite (bool, optional) ‚Äì If True, overwrite existing figures (default: False).

  • show_figs (bool, optional) ‚Äì If True, display figures after creation (default: False).

  • prepare (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether to load plotting data during initialisation (default: True).

  • single_figure (bool, optional) ‚Äì Treat input date as single date, even if dtN_str is passed (default: False).

  • ice_type (str, optional) ‚Äì Type of ice being plotted (‚Äòfast‚Äô or ‚Äòpack‚Äô). Affects file/path resolution.

configÔÉÅ

Full project configuration dictionary from JSON.

Type:

dict

P_zarrÔÉÅ

Path to the main Zarr dataset being plotted.

Type:

Path

plot_var_dictÔÉÅ

Plotting configuration for variables (colorbars, units, ranges).

Type:

dict

plot_dfÔÉÅ

Flat dataframe of points to plot (lat/lon/dat triples).

Type:

pandas.DataFrame

plot_regionÔÉÅ

Region name if plotting subregions.

Type:

str

Examples

>>> from sea_ice_plotter import SeaIcePlotter
>>> plotter = SeaIcePlotter("Rothrock", "1994-09-08", ice_type="fast")
>>> plotter.plot_map(region_name="Weddell", text_str="Fast Ice")
create_animation(var_name=None, region=None, fps=4, codec='libx264')[source]ÔÉÅ

Create an MP4 animation from saved PNG frames.

Parameters:

  • region_name (str, optional) ‚Äì Region label used in filename paths.

  • var_name (str, optional) ‚Äì Variable name to animate. Defaults to self.var_name.

  • fps (int) ‚Äì Frames per second for the output video.

  • suffix (str) ‚Äì File extension for input PNGs (default: .png).

Notes

This method uses ffmpeg under the hood. It must be installed and accessible in the system path. Output file is written to self.D_graph with a standard MP4 filename.

define_hemisphere(hemisphere)[source]ÔÉÅ
plot_facet_regions(var_name=None, region_names=None, cols=3, figsize=(15, 10))[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a multi-panel (faceted) plot of multiple regions.

Parameters:

  • regions (list of str) ‚Äì List of region names from config[‚ÄòAF_regions‚Äô].

  • layout (str) ‚Äì Facet layout, e.g., ‚Äú3x2‚Äù.

  • label_dict (dict, optional) ‚Äì Custom label for each region (title).

Notes

This method generates a grid of subplots using PyGMT subplot functionality. It relies on region extents defined in config[‚ÄòAF_regions‚Äô].

plot_map(projection=None, region=None, region_name=None, cmap=None, cmap_reverse=None, series=None, sq_size=0.03, dt_str=None, cbar_pos='JBC+w10c/0.5c+mc+h', cbar_str=None, units=None, ice_shelves=False, water_color='black', land_color='seashell', shoreline_str='.2p,white', plain_frame=False, frame=None, text_loc=None, text_str=None, text_font='12p,Courier-Bold,black', text_justify='LM', text_fill='white', text_pen='0.5p,black', P_png=None, ow_fig=None, show_figs=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plot sea ice field using PyGMT for either regional or hemispheric view.

This method uses self.plot_df to create a PyGMT scatter map. It supports configurable options for color map, scale, annotations, regional focus, and overlays such as grounded icebergs or shelves.

Parameters:

  • projection (str, optional) ‚Äì GMT-style projection string.

  • region (list or str, optional) ‚Äì Geographic extent as [lon_min, lon_max, lat_min, lat_max].

  • region_name (str, optional) ‚Äì Label for regional subdirectory.

  • cmap (str, optional) ‚Äì Colormap to use.

  • cmap_reverse (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether to reverse the colormap.

  • series (tuple, optional) ‚Äì Min/max data values for colorbar.

  • sq_size (float, optional) ‚Äì Size of PyGMT square symbol.

  • dt_str (str, optional) ‚Äì Date label override for the plot.

  • cbar_pos (str, optional) ‚Äì PyGMT colorbar position string.

  • cbar_str (str, optional) ‚Äì Colorbar label.

  • units (str, optional) ‚Äì Units string for axis.

  • ice_shelves (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether to overlay Antarctic ice shelves.

  • water_color (str, optional) ‚Äì Color to fill water bodies.

  • land_color (str, optional) ‚Äì Color to fill land.

  • shoreline_str (str, optional) ‚Äì Style string for shorelines.

  • plain_frame (bool, optional) ‚Äì If True, removes axis labels and title.

  • frame (str or list, optional) ‚Äì Frame formatting.

  • text_loc (list or tuple, optional) ‚Äì Text label location (lon, lat).

  • text_str (str, optional) ‚Äì Label to overlay on map.

  • text_font (str, optional) ‚Äì Font specification for label.

  • text_justify (str, optional) ‚Äì Justification of text.

  • text_fill (str, optional) ‚Äì Fill behind text.

  • text_pen (str, optional) ‚Äì Outline around text.

  • P_png (str, optional) ‚Äì Override output file path.

  • ow_fig (bool, optional) ‚Äì Force overwrite for this plot.

  • show_figs (bool, optional) ‚Äì Force show for this plot.

plot_map_grounded_icebergs(region, region_name, projection, sq_size, cmap, save_path, use_thinned=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a PyGMT map of grounded iceberg data for a single Antarctic region.

Parameters:ÔÉÅ

regionlist

GMT-style region bounding box [lon_min, lon_max, lat_min, lat_max].

region_namestr

Name of the region (used in filename or title).

projectionstr

PyGMT polar projection string (e.g., ‚ÄòS0/-90/17.5c‚Äô).

sq_sizefloat

Size of square markers for grounded icebergs.

cmapstr

Colormap to use for iceberg count shading.

save_pathstr

Full path to save output PNG.

use_thinnedbool

Whether to use thinned counts or raw grounded iceberg counts.

plot_path(region=None, sim_name=None, var_name=None, D_graph=None, hemisphere=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate figure output path and filename for the current plotting configuration.

This method sets self.P_png to a resolved PNG file path that depends on simulation name, hemisphere, plotting region, and selected variable.

Parameters:

  • region (str, optional) ‚Äì Region name, e.g., ‚ÄúWeddell‚Äù, used for subdirectory.

  • sim_name (str, optional) ‚Äì Simulation name override. Defaults to self.sim_name.

  • var_name (str, optional) ‚Äì Variable name override. Defaults to self.var_name.

  • D_graph (Path, optional) ‚Äì Directory to write to. Defaults to internal plot path.

  • hemisphere (str, optional) ‚Äì Hemisphere label for folder structure.

  • Sets

  • ----

  • self.P_png (str) ‚Äì Full file path to the output PNG.

plot_regions(reg_dict=None, include=None, exclude=None, water_color='white')[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate a set of regional maps based on AFIM regional dictionary.

This method loops through region definitions from config and calls plot_map() with their geographic bounds.

Parameters:

  • reg_dict (dict, optional) ‚Äì Dictionary of AFIM-defined regions (defaults to config).

  • include (list, optional) ‚Äì If provided, only plot these region names.

  • exclude (list, optional) ‚Äì If provided, skip these region names.

  • water_color (str, optional) ‚Äì Water fill color for PyGMT coast (default: ‚Äòwhite‚Äô).

plot_regions_grounded_icebergs(use_thinned=True, sq_size=0.15, cmap='viridis')[source]ÔÉÅ
plot_sectors_grounded_icebergs(kmt_orig_path, kmt_mod_path, n_sectors=9, sector_width=40, lat_limit=-60, start_lon=0, marker_size='0.1c', save=False, save_dir=None, overlay_ice_shelves=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plot sector-based PyGMT maps of newly inserted grounded iceberg cells based on changes in KMT.

Parameters:ÔÉÅ

kmt_orig_pathstr

Path to original KMT file before grounded iceberg masking.

kmt_mod_pathstr

Path to modified KMT file after grounded iceberg masking.

n_sectorsint

Number of longitude sectors to divide the Southern Ocean.

sector_widthint

Width of each longitude sector in degrees.

lat_limitfloat

Latitude cutoff to restrict plotted points (typically -60 for Antarctic shelf).

start_lonfloat

Starting longitude for sector division (0 for Greenwich).

marker_sizestr

Marker size string for PyGMT (e.g., ‚Äú0.1c‚Äù).

plot_timeseries(var_names=None, label=None, save_png=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plot fast ice time series from a multi-day Zarr dataset.

This method extracts one or more 1D variables (e.g., FIA, FIV, etc.) from the Zarr time series dataset and plots them over time.

Parameters:

  • var_names (list of str, optional) ‚Äì List of variable names to plot. Defaults to [‚ÄòFIA‚Äô].

  • label (str, optional) ‚Äì Legend label for this simulation (used if comparing multiple).

  • save_png (bool, optional) ‚Äì If True, save the figure as a PNG. If False, display interactively.

Notes

Requires that self.P_zarr_list is defined (i.e., for multi-date mode).

plot_timeseries_compare(sim_names, var_name=None, label_dict=None, save_png=True, comparison_name='baseline-comparison')[source]ÔÉÅ

Plot the specified fast ice variable from multiple simulations for comparison.

Parameters:

  • sim_names (list of str) ‚Äì List of simulation names to compare.

  • var_name (str) ‚Äì Name of the variable to plot (default is ‚ÄúFIA‚Äù).

  • label_dict (dict, optional) ‚Äì Dictionary mapping sim_name to label to use in plot legend.

  • save_png (bool) ‚Äì Whether to save the figure as PNG (default True).

  • comparison_name (str) ‚Äì Identifier for the saved filename.

Notes

This method instantiates temporary SeaIcePlotter instances for each simulation and collects their time series data.

prepare_data_for_plotting(P_zarr=None, var_name=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load and prepare Zarr data for plotting, handling both single and multi-date windows.

Reads the Zarr file(s), extracts the plotting variable, and flattens the non-zero/non-NaN points into a pandas DataFrame. This prepares the data for visualisation with PyGMT scatter plotting.

For time-averaged variables (e.g., multi-day averages), this method loops over the available Zarr files and computes the mean field across time. For single-date variables (e.g., FIC), only one Zarr file is read.

Parameters:

  • P_zarr (Path, optional) ‚Äì Explicit path to the Zarr file (used for single-date cases).

  • var_name (str, optional) ‚Äì Variable name to load. Defaults to self.default_var.

  • Sets

  • ----

  • self.plot_df (pandas.DataFrame) ‚Äì Columns are ‚Äòlat‚Äô, ‚Äòlon‚Äô, and ‚Äòdat‚Äô (flattened field).

  • self.var_name (str) ‚Äì Name of the loaded variable.

  • self.plt_dt_str (str) ‚Äì Date string for plot title or filename.
